text: Brian Roe (27 January 1939 - 28 June 2014) was an English cricketer. He played first-class cricket for Somerset from 1957 until 1966. He was a right-handed opening batsman. He made four first-class centuries. He later moved to Minor Counties cricket. Here he played for Devon. Roe was born in Cleethorpes, Lincolnshire. He retired from playing cricket during his early seventies. Roe died on 28 June 2014 in Barnstaple, Devon, aged 75. ==References== ==Other websites== * Brian Roe at Cricket Archive * Brian Roe at ESPNcricinfo Category:1939 births Category:2014 deaths Category:English and Welsh cricketers Category:Sportspeople from Devon Category:Sportspeople from Lincolnshire
title: Brian Roe
